column2: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030.
column5: The reduction of GHG emissions will lead to a decrease in air pollution, which in turn will have a positive impact on the target of reducing the yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period.

column2: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030.
column5: The reduction of GHG emissions will lead to a decrease in air pollution, which in turn will have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that Sustainable Aviation Fuel made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025.

column2: Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels, by 2030.
column5: The reduction of GHG emissions will lead to a decrease in air pollution, which in turn will have a positive impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990.

column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62 % compared to 2005
column5: The EU ETS target is closely related to the ETS2 target, as both aim to reduce GHG emissions, and the achievement of the EU ETS target will have a positive impact on the ETS2 target.

column2: The ETS2 is a new EU-wide cap-and-trade economic instrument that covers the CO2 emissions from the combustion of fuels in road transport, buildings, and other sectors
column5: The implementation of the ETS2 may lead to an increase in energy costs for households and industries, which could have a negative impact on the EU ETS target.

column2: Increased national targets in line with an EU-wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005
column5: The ESR target may have a negative impact on the EU ETS target, as the increased costs of reducing GHG emissions in the ESR sectors may lead to an increase in energy costs and a decrease in the competitiveness of EU industries.

column2: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry sector, by 2030
column5: The LULUCF target is closely related to the net GHG emissions reduction target, and the achievement of the LULUCF target will have a positive impact on the net GHG emissions reduction target.

column2: No debit rule
column5: The no debit rule is closely related to the LULUCF target, and the achievement of the no debit rule will have a positive impact on the LULUCF target.

column2: Reduce buildings’ greenhouse gas emissions by 60%, by 2030
column5: The reduction of buildings' GHG emissions will lead to an increase in the demand for individual heat pumps, which will have a positive impact on the target of doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps.

column2: REPowerEU sets a target of 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen production and 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen imports by 2030
column5: The increase in renewable hydrogen production will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the EU ETS target.

column2: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10,000 by 2025
column5: The increase in renewables-based energy communities will lead to an increase in renewable energy production, which will have a positive impact on the REPowerEU target.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42% of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030, and 60% by 2035
column5: The increase in renewable fuels of non-biological origin will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the REPowerEU target.

column2: Double the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
column5: The increase in heat pump deployment will lead to a decrease in buildings' GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of reducing buildings' GHG emissions by 60% by 2030.

column2: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and almost 600 GW by 2030
column5: The increase in solar photovoltaic capacity will lead to an increase in renewable energy production, which will have a positive impact on the REPowerEU target.

column2: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple
column5: The increase in solar heat and geothermal energy demand will lead to an increase in renewable energy production, which will have a positive impact on the target of bringing online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025.

column2: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column5: The increase in PV installation will lead to an increase in renewable energy production, which will have a positive impact on the target of bringing online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%
column5: The increase in renewable energy production will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the REPowerEU target.

column2: Member States shall ensure that waste management operators achieve a yearly target for the recycling of plastics of at least 30 % of the total weight of plastics contained in the vehicles delivered to the waste management operators.
column5: The increase in plastic recycling may lead to an increase in the use of recycled plastics in the chemical and plastic products sector, which could have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that at least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources by 2030.

column2: At least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources by 2030
column5: The increase in the use of sustainable non-fossil sources will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of recycling plastics.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced
column5: The reduction of GHG intensity will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of reducing net GHG emissions by at least 55% compared to 1990 levels.

column2: Sustainable Aviation Fuel made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025
column5: The increase in Sustainable Aviation Fuel will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of reducing net GHG emissions by at least 55% compared to 1990 levels.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990
column5: The reduction of transport sector emissions will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of reducing net GHG emissions by at least 55% compared to 1990 levels.

column2: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity
column5: The reduction of fuel intensity will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: The reduction of transport costs may lead to an increase in transport demand, which could have a negative impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050.

column2: For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles
column5: The increase in the use of zero-emission urban buses will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050.

column2: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles [...] shall be reduced
column5: The reduction of CO2 emissions will lead to a decrease in GHG emissions, which will have a positive impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050.

column2: The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall, except in Cyprus and Malta, be limited to 1.7%
column5: The limitation of biofuels and biogas may lead to an increase in the use of fossil fuels, which could have a negative impact on the target of cutting the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050.

column2: The yearly quantity of aviation fuel uplifted by a given aircraft operator at a given Union airport shall be at least 90% of the yearly aviation fuel required
column5: The increase in the use of aviation fuel will lead to a decrease in tankering practices, which will have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that Sustainable Aviation Fuel made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025.

column2: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU
column5: The increase in renewable hydrogen electrolysers will lead to an increase in renewable energy production, which will have a positive impact on the REPowerEU target.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, the following power output targets are met cumulatively
column5: The increase in power output targets will lead to an increase in the demand for individual heat pumps, which will have a positive impact on the target of doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps.

column2: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them
column5: The increase in recharging pools will lead to an increase in the demand for individual heat pumps, which will have a positive impact on the target of doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed
column5: The increase in recharging pools will lead to an increase in the demand for individual heat pumps, which will have a positive impact on the target of doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps.
